website_summaries.verdict: The perfect choice for beginner's looking to grind a quality cup of joe at home.
pros: The Encore produces quality medium to coarse grinds, perfect for French press, drip, and pour-over coffee
The simple design, and no-fuss setup make this machine extremely user friendly
At this low price point, we were impressed with the weight and quality feel of the materials
As far as grinders go, this one is on the quiet side
cons: Sometimes makes a mess on the counter

website_summaries.verdict: It gets the job done without a lot of bells and whistles, but it has some issues that might concern you.
pros: A basic model with a straight-forward design that comes at a mid-range price
On/off switch is easy to use
cons: The dosing unit is difficult to use, and the motor is noisy

website_summaries.verdict: The Baratza Encore is an excellent choice for home coffee brewers who seek an affordable, highly capable grinder, but its no-frills design isn't best for grinding rookies.
pros: The Baratza Encore burr grinder is affordable considering it packs 40 coarseness settings to supply a wide range of coffee types and brewing styles
It produces grounds that are uniform in size and texture
It's simple to operate, sturdily built and relatively quiet
cons: It also lacks any extra features such as a timer, screen or scale

customer_reviews.title: Grinds fast and true, not too loud
customer_reviews.text: Grinds beans pretty fast. Coffee has been tasting fantastic since buying this; I'm coming from a blade grinder and had been using a manual burr grinder but have found the effort a little much for a daily coffee for two. It runs far quieter than the (cheaper) Cuisinart that a roommate used to have, so it's a pretty acceptable noise level but by no means silent. Pictures give a sense of scale on a countertop. Overall I'm very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Time and Money
customer_reviews.text: Grinder is completely useless on second use. Does not ingest the beans, it simply spits half ground beans back up. Tried cleaning out the machine, but it did not resolve the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Worst engineered product I have ever experienced
customer_reviews.text: Worst engineered product I have ever bought; but don't believe me just watch their own employees online explain how to unclog their product; you will need to watch their videos because you will spend hours and hours breaking the machine down to unclog the coffee beans. Try and get your coffee first because you will be up every week unclogging this disaster of a product. Whoever engineered this product should be fired. I STRONGLY discourage customers from buying this product. You will regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gavrilo Princip

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy unless you want to spend more time unclogging ground coffe than actually grinding coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say the coffee did taste amazing. But with that being said, the machine jammed up after about the 5thtime using it! And then trying to unjam it was a ROYAL pain. Very dissapointedt to have to return but for the price, it shouldn’t get jammed with ground coffee so quickly ( brand new). Trying to stick a paper clip into the hole (which is what the pdf that they emailed me said to do) is next to impossible!
customer_reviews.author: Kari MAC

customer_reviews.title: Annoying!
customer_reviews.text: I used the original version of this grinder for about 13 years and finally replaced it with this. On every grind there are grounds that end up on the counter and all over the inside of the catch container. This grinder also does not give a consistent and uniform grind. Annoying!
customer_reviews.author: personal trainer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never tried any other electric coffee grinder but I can tell you how much I like this one. It does an excellent job of grinding whole coffee beans quickly. I don’t have the problem others seem to have with coffee “dust” flying all over the place. I discovered that if you put one or two drops of water into the hopper you won’t have a problem with static. Also, leaving the coffee in the bottom catcher for one or two minutes settles the ground coffee. I don’t see any need to buy a higher priced grinder when this one does such a perfect job
customer_reviews.author: G. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Clogs easily.  Unclogs with great effort.
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok until I broke my hip and had aides using it. It clogged repeatedly. Monumental clogs that required me to work hours to remove them. I learned to hate this grinder. It needs redesign. I am throwing it out after only 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Quality grinder
customer_reviews.text: I very much appreciate the build quality of this grinder. The reason I chose the Baratza is because it repairable. Baratza will send you any part, no matter how small, so you can fix your own grinder for a modest cost. I am sick of tossing appliances in the landfill because of something like a broken microswitch. Another good thing about this grinder: it does not clog as easily as some of the competition...and it is quite easy to clean when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Whipple

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but avoid seller Barista Lab
customer_reviews.text: The product is wonderful, but DO watch out for seller "Barista Lab" who sent my second one in the state in the pictures. Basically a used, dirty, and with the rubber ring mangled.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Kuhn Andriotti

customer_reviews.title: Quit grinding after two weeks
customer_reviews.text: Received this product on May 22nd 2018 and as of June 1st it quit grinding. We cleaned the product as we grind every other day. We did purchase the warranty which we rarely do but glad we did on this product. Hoping the seller honors our warranty. If not it will be returned and will never buy from Kitchen Kapers again.
customer_reviews.author: Jb

customer_reviews.title: Bought two - neither worked
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but feel compelled to because I bought this coffee grinder and it stopped working after a week. Returned it for a replacement and the second one stopped grinding after two weeks. Users Manual shows how to clean the mechanism if it stops grinding - but who wants to do that every two weeks?
customer_reviews.author: Terry Berenson

customer_reviews.title: Messy
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After 14 months, this coffee grinder stopped working. It will not turn on. Please save your money. I've had this product for almost a year and while it does a good job grinding coffee beans, every time you take the plastic grounds bin out it sprays coffee grounds all over the kitchen counter. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably Priced/Best Value
customer_reviews.text: The knocks about this machine making a mess are pretty lame (IMHO): It takes just a little mindfulness and recognition of the fact you're dealing with a fine, light, organic material that is going to exhibit some degree of static attraction to most materials However, armed with that knowledge, I give the grinder receptacle a light tap before removing it from the grinder body, and use a light brush and a couple of whisks to clear the grinds from the receptacle into the drip basket. It's not REAL noisy, but I do ensure the bedroom door is closed if my wife is still sleeping because it's not as quiet as the beefier machines.
customer_reviews.author: James Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Burr Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace a burr grinder that had stopped working - purchase based on site reviews. Out of the box putting together was a bit of a challenge with the small rubber gasket sitting below coffee container - not intuitive or easy so could take a few minutes. Grinder works well but is LOUD ! Without a doubt the noisiest appliance I have even used. Would not have purchased if I knew about noise level.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This coffee grinder cost about twice what my old one cost and is money well spent. It is reasonably quiet, produces a uniform grind, and the ground coffee empties easily out of the container. My old one produced a powder that got on my hands and the counter, and I had to wash it out of the container. Don't waste your money on a cheap grinder. For each grind, I measure the beans into the hopper. This produces the desired quantity. After a couple of months, I'm still happy. By experimenting, I found it grinds four coffee measures in 10 seconds. I grind six measures in 15 seconds. A real time saver.
customer_reviews.author: Don Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Clogs, Clogs, Clogs and I don't mean wooden shoes!
customer_reviews.text: First grind with the new machine went well, yes it dumps grinds all over the counter because of static. Why they don't build these machines with electrical grounds to dissipate static I don't know. 2nd time grinding went OK, but after the 3rd time, no luck, clogged so bad I had to take the thing apart and clean. Stay away froma bad design. Noisy and cheaply made. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Nugent

customer_reviews.title: Perfect White Elephant Gift!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this handsome machine loaded with promises as a Father's Day gift for the coffee man in my life. It was as loud as a chainsaw. It was like building a clock every time we cleaned it. It needed to be cleaned at least once a week for optimal performance. (YouTube has great how-to videos.) It took at least a minute to grind a cup of beans. If you do not clean it regularly, you can fold laundry while waiting for your perfect grind. Good luck to whoever gets my gift.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Butterfly

customer_reviews.title: The grinder stopped working after a few months of use.
customer_reviews.text: It worked about six times and then clogged. The hopper just tosses beans around without grinding them. I performed the cleaning tasks by watching the video several times. Then contacted the manufacturer and followed their instructions of using a paper clip to clean out the machine. The third party vendor would not accept a return past thirty days and the manufacturers keeps sending me cleaning instructions. All the maintenance for no results. I cannot recommend this product or the vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Marybeth

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model because it was recommended by Wirecutter, the New York Times' consumer guide to products. The machine s very noisy, The first problem I encountered was that there is no way to set the amount of coffee you want ground. You can't set there machine to grind coffee for four cups. Then after I could no longer return the machine to Amazon, the plastic cone that holds the coffee came loose and would no longer stay in place atop the machine. I will have to dispose of the machine and go back to the Krups grinder that i have been using for years.
customer_reviews.author: Peter L.

customer_reviews.title: Noisy + Stopped Working After 1 Week
customer_reviews.text: Purchased based on consistently strong ratings. Intended for daily use. From the start, we noticed the grinder made much more NOISE than comparable grinders we've owned over the years (we grind coffee daily). After a week, it stopped working - it still makes noise, but either it stops grinding altogether, or slows significantly. Either way, not good. We're hoping to return it. Off to find another grinder!
customer_reviews.author: Caromcg

customer_reviews.title: Simply Works Well! Easy to Clean! Grind Settings Very Precise!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I don't need digital displays, timers, and whatever other gimmicks they add onto these devices. This thing WORKS! And it works well; I found the assembly and disassembly for cleaning is quite easy, making cleanup almost enjoyable. This is slightly noisier than my other grinders, but until they make a completely silent motor, I'll just make do with it. The noise level actually isn't that bad, considering what it's doing, breaking dried beans into grounds.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Durbin

customer_reviews.title: Best grinder in the $140ish range
customer_reviews.text: I’m surprised how well this grinder is made for $140. My grinder was pulled off the shelf onto the floor and nothing broke, not even the burrs got misaligned. If you want to cap your grinder budget at $100, I’d say go the extra or save a bit longer. I also have the Bodum Bistro which I thought was pretty good until I tried this. Not for espresso but great for drip, pour over and even French press, no other lower cost grinder have I seen make good grinds for Press.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Young

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built, may need calibration by the user
customer_reviews.text: Good grinder in general. A bit messy, but works reliably. I believe the burrs on mine are not calibrated properly, as I have to dial it down to a much lower number to get a standard drip grind - several other reviewers have said the same. There are apparently online directions to calibrate the burrs, but it does seem that this is an issue numerous users are finding - I would expect a little more consistent manufacturing for the cost. Will update this review once I've recalibrated and see if it's better.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Does not grind fine enough
customer_reviews.text: This grinder was rated so highly by so many people that I thought it must be amazing. Turns out it's not really. If you want an amazing grinder you will need to pay more I suppose. Four issues with this one: 1) You need to set it to the finest grind setting to get a grind suitable for drip coffee. I had assumed that the finest grind settings would be good for espresso, but that's not the case. 2) It delivers uneven grind at all settings. You get some big chunks and some dust no matter the setting. 3) Everytime you take out the hopper you get grinds and coffee dust on your counter. 4) It's a very loud machine
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Who Reads

customer_reviews.title: Immediate letdown
customer_reviews.text: I was excited for this to arrive, I made the decision to splurge a bit on a better grinder after years of Cuisinart. Sadly, whether it was a fluke or not, my machine did not work at all. Every level gave me the same terrible grind, no consistency. It ground my beans up like a blade, huge chunks of unusable mess. I have to assume, based on reviews, that my situation was possibly unique. But, that said, it happened. Amazon was great and allowed me to return immediately, with no hassle, but I opted to look elsewhere. Hope others had better luck than I, but beware this grinder is not bulletproof.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Reed

customer_reviews.title: Poor setup and use instructions
customer_reviews.text: This coffee grinder is top-rated on Wirecutter. However, there are significant problems. Instructions for setup and use are not clear. There are Web support videos which don't seem to agree with the (very short) instructions provided with the item. I could never get it to grind for espresso. It also clogs quickly and the on-line video instructions for clearing clogs runs 20 minutes and amounts to digging around in the grinding area with a small angled hex-wrench. Not at all user friendly. I returned the item. I have found the OXO Brew Grinder to be much easier to use and it grinds espresso right (and is less expensive).
customer_reviews.author: D. Redfearn

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Heed the other reviews that say how easily this grinder clogs and what a pain it is to clean! Mine came clogged from the get-go. After hours of digging our impacted coffee grounds I put in some beans and turned it on for the first time. Almost no coffee came out and it was just as jammed as when it came out of the box! This unit came with no instructions, no cleaning tools, and basically dirty out of the box. It’s like they’re punishing us for buying it. I wanted to like this grinder - very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nels Lindberg

customer_reviews.title: Locked up and useless
customer_reviews.text: Within 3 months the grinder locked up solid and does not function. Tried the cleaning pellets- no help. Sadly this grinder was highly recommended by friends. Highly disappointed and out $135. I would like to try another one but I’m doubtful about it’s durability.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne 1

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: giving it one stars because it actually does grind coffee. Poorly constructed Cheaply made...the on off knob continuously falls off during grinding. So annoying when the knob falls to the ground and you cannot turn off the grinder eventually the motor will burn out. I would not recommend this grinder to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: gary  keener

customer_reviews.title: Died after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this machine on March 2018 and now it dead. It is September 2018. I did everything I was supposed to do to keep it clean. Not good. Worked good for the first several months then died. It was not a cheap purchase but a cheap product.
customer_reviews.author: E. Aguirre

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee but grinds end up in strange places.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for three months now and it works great. The only issue I've found is the inexplicable ability for coffee grinds to get into places it doesn't seem possible. They somehow end up underneath the output bin despite there appearing to be no gap for them to get through. They also manage to wedge themself through the rubber gasket to get trapped on the side of the hopper. On the plus side it all comes apart so everything can be brushed out in a couple minutes when needed.
customer_reviews.author: A. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grinder
customer_reviews.text: I have a coffee connoisseur in my family, and this is what he uses. It grinds exceedingly well. It's not a quiet process, but that's because it's grinding hard beans! I really like how easy it is to vary the grind and yes, it's easy to clean. Hint: When done grinding but before taking the coffee out, hold the grinder and gently "rap" the feet of the grinder against the counter to knock loose grounds clinging to the sides. Bottom line: You buy this and you won't have to buy twice.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Faith AdairTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Worked (with light use) only 3 weeks!
customer_reviews.text: So that was disappointing. Not a cheap grinder, but after only 3 weeks it stopped grinding. The little wheel at the top kept spinning, but the conical burr inside stopped rotating. Was not clogged, so I sent it back. Another observation I made when I first got it is that in order to get a good grind, one had to set it at the finest level. Setting it at any other grind made for choppy, large pieces. Do NOT recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Artist

customer_reviews.title: Seems ok
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because of the great reviews. When we got the product and assembled it, we noticed that it was making a grinding noise around 10 setting and we called tech-support and they said it was normal and that we should try to use the setting just above that for the finest grind. We tried using that for making espresso and it was far too course to be used. Very disappointed. Contacted them again and they said the grinding is normal at 10 and to try gronding beans lower for espresso. Seemed to grind ok at 6.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure metal ring burr white plastic alignment “thingy” did not come loose during shipment.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my Baratza virtuoso which motor burned out after 15 years. I could not get the darned thing to work until I realized the plastic alignment “thingy” surrounding the metal ring burr had come loose during shipment, the assembly was not seating properly, and, at the coarsest setting I was slowly getting coffee grounds finer than talcum powder. So make sure that the metal ring burr is firmly seated and “bottomed” on the white plastic alignment thingy. Then make sure the red tab on the alignment thingy is at the 5 o’Clock position.
customer_reviews.author: G. G. Pique

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. An Inexplicably Bonehead Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Grinds well, but makes a mess in the process because of the poorly designed cup that receives the ground coffee. It doesn't capture it all. Ridiculous for the selling price. Seriously, the only reason I haven't returned it is because I've had to do a lot of returns lately and I'm tired of it. So I just apply pressure to the container while grinding, holding it in tightly. Even doing this doesn't eliminate all the mess, but it minimizes it. It's just baffling to me that during the design process that someone must have thought this problem was no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: generic

customer_reviews.title: 50% failure rate for me (updated)
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these; the first one is still going strong in a restaurant setting. The second one died a couple months ago. I need to get in touch with Baratza to get a replacement. It makes noise, but grinds nothing. UPDATE: I contacted the manufacture and was pleasantly surprised with customer service. Simple plastic part designed to break to avoid more damage needed replacing. They mailed it. Easier than expected. Put back two stars.
customer_reviews.author: J. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months...
customer_reviews.text: This burr coffee grinder is great quality and grinds very evenly. It's still new but so far it's perfect! June 2019 update: It stopped grinding coffee. It still turns on but doesn't grind the coffee. VERY disappointing! The little cheap grinder I had before worked for YEARS. Purchased 12/21/18. Stopped working 6/13/19. The "Return window closed on Jan 31, 2019. Product support window closed on Mar 21, 2019." How convenient, right before it stops working.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Daniel

customer_reviews.title: It's The Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: This isn't your mama's coffee grinder, this is the real deal. Has made whole beans very desirable now. The old grinder literally ground the coffee into powder...no bueno,. This one produces the perfect sized ground, and therefore, makes a much better cup of coffee. It now sits on the counter, as it is very attractive and has a small footprint. Very happy to have bought this grinder. As far as versatility .. it grinds coffee! I can't think what else I'd use it for without compromising the taste of the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: happy customer

customer_reviews.title: A great grinder
customer_reviews.text: I have used a Rancillio Rocky for over 10 years, and it had started giving me some small problems. I decided it was time for a new grinder and started researching. Since I don't grind for espresso (and have my Rocky if I need to), I wanted a grinder that would work well for my Technivorm, Aeropress, pour over, French Press, etc. The Encore is perfect. I weigh out my beans, so I don't need fancy timers, etc. I just need a consistent grind, and the Encore is perfect. Check out "Real Chris Baca" on YouTube, he uses and loves the Encore.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Denson

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this
customer_reviews.text: New out of the box it worked for 1 minute making french press grind then it stopped - spent an hour watching barzata videos on trouble shooting and tried to get it running again Its so jammed I cannot clear it - packed it up and sending back AVOID THIS PRODUCT DESPITE THE GOOD REVIEWS
customer_reviews.author: Steven Meyrich

customer_reviews.title: Very frustrating to use, cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Despite following the instructions carefully, the hopper was extremely difficult to install correctly. The little plastic piece inside ultimately broke before I can use it. Very disappointed and frustrated with this item, definitely not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Hoyt Yun Yang

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift and not sure if my unit was defective or if they are all like this but I do not recommend this product. Previously I had a black and decker burr grinder and wanted to upgrade to this. Worked okay the first time but seemed a bit slow. Had it at a setting 30 the second time around and it just clogged itself. Ground the beans to basically a dust and nothing could pass through. Took it apart, cleaned it and it worked for a couple seconds and then same issue. Pretty disappointing given the price and brand name
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Lopez

customer_reviews.title: construction seemed to lack fit and finish. clogged with ...
customer_reviews.text: construction seemed to lack fit and finish. clogged with dark roast beans. i just did not understand why this grinder got such high reviews.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Returned two of these
customer_reviews.text: Bought one and had to exchange it or a second. less than 3 months for both. The grind we good, but jammed up frequently. Went back to the Capresso, which we have had 2 of, both lasting about 4 years. I think the issue is, we are using french roast beans, which tend to be oily. Found this our online, just searching grinders. Reinforced this, in our new Capresson manual. Clean every day or so, do easy. The Barataza had pamphlet of many languages, on how to assemble and nothing about maintenance. It grind well, for the few weeks it worked.
customer_reviews.author: RhodeNet

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work right out the box. Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Although I read several great reviews before purchase I am completely disappointed with this grinder. I assembled the grinder, filled the hopper about half full of French roast beans, and turned it on. The beans would shift around in the hopper but it didn’t grind the coffee. I watched several videos to confirm I was operating correctly, spent a great deal of time ensuring it was not clogged and still could not make it work. I even tried grinding with a coarse setting without success. It may work with a less oily light or medium roast but doesn’t work with dark roast coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Randall B. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I have worked around heavy equipment which was quieter. This thing was build with left over gears which whir very loud even when no beans are being ground. I didn't know anyone even built stuff like this any more. Static is terrible. Large amounts of bean grindings stick all over the outside of the catcher and it has to be cleaned or you get bean stuff all over the kitchen. Wear hearing protection when in confined spaces like the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: JJ. Dober

customer_reviews.title: Clogs A LOT, and very hard to unclog!
customer_reviews.text: When this grinder actually works without clogging it is great. However it clogs A LOT! I even tried only filling the hopper up 1/4 of the way, but it still clogged up. The company that makes it actually had to create a Youtube video instructing how to unclog it! You have to take it apart, and use a very small Alan wrench to loosen up the coffee grains. The wire pipe cleaner that comes with it doesn't even work to unclog it! I DO NOT RECOMMEND this grinder, especially when considering the expensive price. Cheaper coffee grinders are much less frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Fast Shipper

customer_reviews.title: Same Problem As The Other 300+ 1 Star Reviews
customer_reviews.text: Just like everyone else. After a handful of uses becomes unusable due to chronic clogging. We are very picky when it comes to keeping things clean but this grinder is ridiculous. It's very labor intensive to clean and unclog just to have it do the same thing the second you turn it back on. I understand the burr grinder is the way to go for grinding coffee but avoid this one at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J

customer_reviews.title: Brought my Chemex game up a bazillion levels from the hand grinder I was using (which is great in its own right
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this really can't be beat. Brought my Chemex game up a bazillion levels from the hand grinder I was using (which is great in its own right; but this is next level). ALSO — Baratza's customer service is incredible. They're super accessible, super kind, and eager to help you make the best coffee. Almost every part in the Encore is replaceable. I accidentally put the rubber hopper gasket on wrong and ripped it; $2 later, I had another one sent out to me. Unlike cheaper grinders, everything in this machine is replaceable individually, letting you keep it tuned up and going for years and years.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Stopped feeding beans and is quite noisy.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love this product but it has stopped working after only a few weeks of use with beans no longer feeding through burrs. Simple effective design with easy cleaning access but alas no luck. Tried cleaning and disassembling multiple times. Worked excellently out of box and all of a sudden grind production slowed and stopped and now beans get caught and continually ground finer causing blockage and jam. Gave this a chance after coming from considerably more expensive grinders like rancilio and sorry to say this unit is not the same quality. It is also quite noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Helming

customer_reviews.title: Arrives Unassembled
customer_reviews.text: Buyer's remorse kicked in the moment I opened the carton & found a very heavy case in one box & parts in another to be fitted on it in 5 steps. Sellers often give notice of partial assembly; this seller gives no notice that complete assembly is required. Instructions are fuzzy & incomplete. "If Step 5 is not working," it reads, they describe another procedure. I wish beforehand I had read the long review of grinders at seriouseats.com, which covers the two Baratza models in detail & burr vs. blade grinders in general. I'm keeping my 30-year old Krupp blade.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: The best grinder evah
customer_reviews.text: I had a Cuisinart which had to be at least 95db (that's almost as loud as a jet engine) when you turned it on. It literally woke up my entire neighborhood. The Baratza has many things going for it. It is quiet, has metal burrs (my old one had plastic burrs) and it can grind a little or a lot of coffee at one time without sacrificing grind. I grind everything from esspresso to perk/drip. It's easy to change grind even if you've already started grinding. It also doesn't get very hot with extended use since the motor is lower rpm and higher torque. My neighbors love the Baratza almost as much as I do.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth David

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and LOUD
customer_reviews.text: Started off great, grinding beans without a lot of noise. Then is started making a high pitched whining noise when grinding and the instruction manual doesn't address what to do if this happens. I've cleaned the grinder and tried every trouble shooting suggestion, but nothing works. Also the collection bin (where the grounds drop into) doesn't stay in place anymore so I have to hold it in place when beans are being ground, otherwise the vibration of the motor causes the bin to move and grounds go everywhere. Would not buy again or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slap-n-Grind
customer_reviews.text: When it worked, it was fine. Ours stopped 24 months after purchase, and was only used twice a week. It just died, then revived when my husband slapped it. Then it stopped again. Slap, grind, slap grind...keep some ground coffee as backup? I see others’ broke before ours so...we should feel lucky? I won’t buy another from this company, that’s for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Cloudy skies

customer_reviews.title: Most efficient grinder for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Considered changing burrs on my 20 yr old (Baratza) Solis Maestro (which still worked fine) but, at this price, it seemed just as well to buy the Encore. Took a few tries to find the right dial to pull a double espresso on my really old Rancilio Silvia but 6 to 7 worked with these beans. It’s noisy but it’s coffee beans, after all. Grind could not be much better. Baratza do a simple and efficient grinder. My experience with them is very positive. See questions on how to install gasket - only tricky part at first try. Easy really.
customer_reviews.author: yagas

customer_reviews.title: Big step up
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a Krups burr grinder that probably cost less than half of the price of this one, but worth the upgrade. Its noticeably quieter (although not silent by any means) and grinds more slowly (and therefore generates less heat). Grinds seem very consistent. I don't get as much static cling on the container as I did with the Krups. Its also reasonably easy to clean. Had is for at least six months now and continues to work great, most days grinding coffee for two pots of coffee, without a hitch
customer_reviews.author: Carlo

customer_reviews.title: Consistent grind, wide range of grinds, solid product, simple assembly
customer_reviews.text: I've run several rounds of whole bean through this grinder and am very impressed with the consistency of the grind. It grinds perfectly well for french press and drip coffee, and could probably go fine enough for espresso as well. The machine has a substantial weight and appears well constructed. In can grind a pretty significant amount of beans in 1-2 minutes, so the machine doesn't need much time to do it's thing. It's not very noisy, but I wouldn't recommend running it early in the morning while others are sleeping. The price initially seemed a bit steep, but the product has produced results worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: BROKE AFTER ONLY 3 MONTHS OF ONCE MONTHLY USE
customer_reviews.text: It clogged during every use. Of course now after only 3 months of having the grinder, with only once per month use to grind 12oz of coffee it has broken. It is completely clogged and despite my efforts with all of the youtube tutorials, nothing is fixing the issue. To add insult to injury, the "return window" closed one month after purchase, so I'm stuck with having to find an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Karly Treacy

customer_reviews.title: No longer a reliable product.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered product Jan. 2019–sounded like a locomotive. Returned item and reordered Feb 2019 and to (Jul. 2019) it quit working. For the purchase price this is a huge disappointment. I had owned one prior to the January 2019 purchase for 8 years w/o a problem. If anyone know anyone knows of any recourse, please advise!!! Poor reflection on Amazon AND Baratza.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning this grinder is a grind!
customer_reviews.text: It should not take an engineering degree to continue to use this expensive coffee grinder. The problem with this is that I have only used the grinder three times but needed to clean the grinder out before each bag was completely ground. I followed the assembly instructions carefully. And, I read the cleaning instructions carefully and the grinder did not perform better. I watched the online instructions and followed the steps and the performance is no better. I owned several grinders by different makers previously and never had this issue. I am abandoning this grinder as I am outside the return and support window. I will be going with a different brand after only a limited amount of uses.
customer_reviews.author: Dan W. Durst

customer_reviews.title: terrible grind - the same on all settings
customer_reviews.text: I've had several of these grinders, and loved them. My new one though is terrible. We can only get a "rough" grind, even on the finest setting, and no where what we need. In fact, the grind doesn't really change no matter what setting we put it on. Also, there is a strong smell of plastic, and the brush that comes with it was different - not the soft brush I've had before, but a hard conical shaped brush. Maybe we were sent a used grinder, though I paid full price. I'm very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Clogs
customer_reviews.text: This grinder does nothing but clog and make a mess. Once clogged I then have to spend 20 minutes unclogging it with a bent paper clip. I can only grind about 1/2 lb of beans until it clogs even when I’m extremely careful to not overfill the holding bin. You can’t see through the bin so you have to time the grind or it instantly clogs if overfilled. Also you can’t help but get ground coffee every where when using it. The one bright spot is when not clogged it grinds nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Uniform grind, improved coffee
customer_reviews.text: Have held off on burr grinder for some time. But I am finding that the burr machine's uniform grind (compared with choppy blade grinder) makes for a much smoother cup of coffee. What everyone says is true-- the burr gives you less bitterness from over-chopped particles, and fewer large coffee chunks that are not extracted and dilute the coffee's flavor. The noise level is not bad, actually significantly quieter than my old blade grinder. Very happy with this purchase, it is a bit of an investment but if it holds up, will improved my morning coffee substantially.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably Priced, Accurate Grind
customer_reviews.text: Has a small footprint on the counter. Grinds from very fine for espresso to coarse for French press and cold brew with a lot of clicks in between. Has been in service for 3 years, used twice daily or more often with never a problem. Negative: The catch drawer tends to ride forward while grinding. Then when the drawer is removed fines are spilled onto the counter. I keep a paper towel under it to monitor and control mess.
customer_reviews.author: George Peters

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what it should. You can set it as fine or as course as you want. It grinds into a handy, removable compartment. I haven't had any issues with coffee ending up all over from overflow or static or any other phenomena I read about while looking at coffee grinder reviews. It is a little loud, but you only need to run in for a minute or less at a time. And, it's a grinder, I expect it to be loud. The hopper is a good size. The machine is compact enough to stay on my counter and push back under my cabinets. I couldn't have asked for this to be any better.
customer_reviews.author: 2GirlsMom

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee grinder. Does a great job.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee bean grinder. I have had this grinder for about 2 weeks and have ground at setting #18 for auto-drip and at setting #8 for espresso grind. Very pleased with my purchase. Noise is not bad, certainly more quiet than my old grinder. Very easy to use. The ground coffee is easy to manage with the removable bin. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Solid Burr Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Four months in here are the pros, cons, and overall from my perspective. Pros: Adjustable grind settings allow for a wide range of applications, resulting grinds are consistent, product is easy to use, noise level is acceptable (quieter than some blade grinders), looks good. Cons: Cleaning is challenging, grinds have a tendency to static cling to upper shoot resulting in grinds spilling on counter. Overall: I recommend buying this burr grinder for someone who is looking to get the most out of their coffee brewing equipment. It takes more effort to maintain then a simple blade grinder, but the quality, adjustability, and ability to replace the burrs make this a good option for someone looking to upgrade their grinding equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Stove

customer_reviews.title: Great Entry Level Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I am real happy with the Baratza Conical grinder. We've used a smaller/cheaper grinder for years, but it uses blades to chop the beans instead of burrs that actually grind the beans. I've read for some time that grinding is better and I am now a firm believer. We've enjoyed several pots of great coffee and wish we'd made the change much sooner. This grinder is considerably less expensive than others making it a great grinder for those wanting to "taste" the difference, but don't want to shell out 2-3 hundred dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Stewart

customer_reviews.title: My Daily Grind(er)
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a previous purchase of the same grinder, lost to a flood. When I plugged it in and ran the ‘cleaning’ batch I was unpleasantly surprised by the coarseness of the grind. I had it set in the middle but the output looked like boulders. I tried a few more batches at finer and finer grind settings all with the same boulder output. A quick trip the the Common Problems section of the Baratza website and there was my problem! I made thr necessary change and have been grinding perfect coffee every mornin since. Could be a tad quieter, but it’s not really an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle J. Warendorf

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder
customer_reviews.text: We have had this grinder for over a year now. I checked around and decided to purchase this grinder. It has been exactly what I wanted. We usually use it for our French press, but I've also used it for a few espressos. It gives an even grind. It's quick and easy and fits perfectly into our morning coffee routine. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Julian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pour over use and more
customer_reviews.text: I use pour over but like a finer grind. This burr grinder is perfect for my needs. It will grind finer than what would use, so with setting scale going from 0 to 40, I use a setting around 10. My only complain is the length of the cord, which seems very long and it is bulky. I wish there is a way to tuck it inside of the grinder body so only a necessary length would stick out. Really, this is a minor gripe, the grinder itself is great so far. This is a first impression review. I will update if encounter any issues down the road, but so far I’m very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: MyPrime

customer_reviews.title: Better off smashing beans on the sidewalk with a rock.
customer_reviews.text: Don't forget to buy a bbq skewer because that is the best tool to use to unclog this thing. Absolutely no way to get through 1 hopper without having to unclog this grinder. OVER $130 BUCKS !!!! I drink coffee so that I can work. Working this hard to get my coffee is a cruel joke. I would rather buy a cheaper grinder that dies every couple of years as long as it worked. It is less than 24 hours old and now we are stuck with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: C is for Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is going to be the best coffee grinder you can find. It is much better than the value ones as it is a conical burr grinder, which means two disks spin and grind the beans. Basically it make an even grind which is important when making certain coffees such as cold brew or French press as you want uniform grinds. There are much more expensive grinders as well as much more inexpensive grinders but this is the beat middle of the road option. I have had it for years now and it has held up.
customer_reviews.author: D C

customer_reviews.title: works well when it works
customer_reviews.text: just outside the return window, the grind comes out uneven, and the top loader keeps adjusting when the grinder runs. i took it apart and cleaned it, double checked my alignments, but it consistently malfunctions. coffee grounds go everywhere, it is very messy. when it works correctly, it does a nice job.
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 12.18.2018 effective 8.21.2019 it quit working. How can I return this device??
customer_reviews.author: MTD

customer_reviews.title: Take care of it and it will work well for years.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a high quality, easy to maintain grinder if you just take care of it. You might see other poor reviews saying that it stopped working, including that video that someone posted where it’s just spinning, not grinding. This happens when you let it get clogged by not emptying the tray enough. If there are ground beans filling the tray, you need to stop grinding! And if you do accidentally do that, read the instructions... it’s very easy to clear out the jam with a paperclip.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: First bean grinder
customer_reviews.text: Short and sweet it's not a fast grinder. It works exactly as listed on the manufacturer's website so no foul there. Was in my budget, and works great. The point that sold me on it is, its repairable as the normal wear and tear of time take place. It is made to be that way. It's not a $25 toss it out when it breaks product. You can replace the burrs and most any part on the device. I checked the prices for parts very reasonable. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Thebrenn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect at-home burr grinder
customer_reviews.text: This grinder got a top rating on Wirecutter, which is why I chose it. This is an entry level burr grinder, but really I don’t find any need for bells and whistles. I’ve had it for a few months, and my coffee has definitely improved. I am very happy not to hand-grind anymore. It was easy to set up, easy to use, and seems like a work-horse. I recieved it as a birthday gift, and I think it would make an amazing gift for a loved one who loves coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Timm

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Effective Grinder
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is new, so I don't yet have a rating for ease of cleaning. Other than that it does just exactly what we want, grind beans evenly to help produce a great pot of coffee. The machine is much louder than our last grinder, but our last grinder was not a burr grinder and I've read they all make a considerable amount of noise. At any rate, in our particular house the noise is not so loud it wakes up whichever partner might still be asleep. The grinder is very study and stays in place on the countertop. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Valenka

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mess
customer_reviews.text: This machine does its job well and beans are ground to the precise size. However, it is also a constant source of frustration because it is impossible to take the grinds canister out without coffee grinds getting all over the counter; they fall from the grinding mechanism after the canister is removed. Grinding coffee goes like this: grind the beans, vigorously tap the machine against the counter with hopes that it’ll knock grinds into the canister, remove the canister, watch the machine drop grinds all over the counter like confetti, wipe up the counter, enjoy. I feel that, at this price point, the manufacturer could have taken a simple step to rectify this annoying a basic issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This thing works like a champ. It's not as fast as some, but the grind is very consistent and it makes it very fine for espresso. If you like your grind to look like flour, this does it. It's well made, feels solid. I almost went with another brand that looked fancier, but im glad i went to this one. It's understated, easy to use, and perfectly functional.
customer_reviews.author: LebowskiAchiever

customer_reviews.title: Extremely noisy
customer_reviews.text: We are returning this coffee grinder for three reasons: It is insanely loud, it is very slow, and it does not turn off by itself after grinding. It was so loud that we ground our coffee outside this morning so as not to wake our guests. I am not exaggerating, it is deafening! It is an expensive grinder and we were replacing a Capresso that worked very well for five years and then simply stopped working. We will purchase another Capresso for much less.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: It's a beast (In a good way)
customer_reviews.text: We had a coffee grinder we thought was really good until it failed one day and couldn't be repaired. Went to a coffee reviewer's website who recommended this one. It was a game changer! The grind is uniform which makes the coffee so much better with continuity in the brew every time. It grinds quickly and the choices in grind will please every coffee drinker's taste. It is larger and does take up real estate on your counter but if you love a good cup of fresh ground coffee, it is so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne St

customer_reviews.title: Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Encore 9 months ago and it plugged pretty quickly. Cleaned it out as recommended, and a it plugged again. This time I contacted Baratza and we determined that a small plastic part had broken (and likely ended up in my coffee grounds). They sent me video links to show me how to replace the part. The unfortunate thing is this requires a complete tear-down of the motor assembly to replace the sub-par plastic widget. They would not replace the 9 month old (in warranty) grinder, but expect me to be a service technician and replace their design flawed part. Really? Not a good customer service response. Can't recommend this product for others.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: Super simple to use, very consistent grind in the medium area. If your doing pour over, drip, moka pot, and maybe french press you're set. This is the best entry level grinder on the market, period. It can do a pressurized portafilter espresso grind, but doesn't have the precision to dial in a bottomless portafilter so it's probably not the best choice for that. If you plan on doing anything but espresso this guys got you covered. You can also upgrade the burrs to the Virtuoso burrs for like 25 bucks and boom, you've got a 230 dollar grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Colin H.

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: This fairly nice looking grinder is a bit bigger than my previous one, and slightly noisier. It seems to produce an even grind, but is definitely more of a pain to clean. The O-ring is hard to install, and comes off every time I open it for cleaning, which makes me not want to clean it as often as I probably should. Coffee grounds do certainly get scattered around it, and I have had to place it on a pie tin, which detracts from the appearance. Still, it makes for good coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald S.

customer_reviews.title: Had problems with grinder but they are replacing (one year warranty)
customer_reviews.text: I had problems with this grinder--too long to grind and it quite working after 6 months. I believe it needs to be cleaned often. I sent an email to the manufacturer and they have been very helpful and are sending me a new one with the one I have being returned for free. Hopefully this one with hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Best burr
customer_reviews.text: I really love this grinder, do not regret the purchase! However, it's messy- you get grounds on the counter each time you remove the receptacle. It's also fairly loud, enough that my partner insists to grind the morning coffee the night before... Overall very happy with it, wide range of grind settings, has lasted years with no problem, and makes consistently excellent quality fresh grounds for my fancy hipster brew methods :) never going back to the blade grinder now that I've known the pleasures of the burr!
customer_reviews.author: elyse

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this grinder. I’m about 3 months in and it’s awesome. My morning coffee ritual includes a rotation of pour over, vacuum siphon, French press, aero press, stovetop espresso... and this has handled each grind appropriately. I had to experiment to get the settings I want, but once it’s locked in, it’s perfect. Coming from blade grinding (inconsistent size and burned grounds), to hand grinders (inconsistent size and difficult re-setting for different extraction methods), this is magic. Of course- it is louder than a hand grinder- so I keep that handy when the house is asleep. It’s a great product and I look forward to years of good results.
customer_reviews.author: J.W. Wickham

customer_reviews.title: Maintenance is nearly impossible
customer_reviews.text: The machine gets jammed with grinds. The shute where the ground coffee comes out is tiny and difficult to reach. The machine just stops delivering ground coffee. There is no warranty worth taking the risk on this grinder. By the way, nice review on YouTube, but no realization that after a while they machine is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Danie

customer_reviews.title: Solid home-use kitchen counter essential
customer_reviews.text: My most snobbish gourmet coffee friend explained that the grinder was more important than the machine to make good espresso. He wanted me to spend $1500 on a commercial grinder and stick with a $300 espresso machine. I resisted his advice, found the Baratza and it has worked flawlessly. It is much quieter than my ten year-old $40 Cuisinart grinder. The dial switch to turn it on/off is on the side rather than the front but that is a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Freshly ground coffee is the way to go and I am glad I bought this grinder.
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this 5 starts on all ratings, even on noise level. It regards to noise level, this is a grinder. It makes noise. However, I don't find it overly loud and the noise does not bother me. The grinder works great. I recommend watching the company's YouTube video for setup and there is a calibration video if you want a finer grind. It worked perfect for me out of the box and I like the simplicity of the controls.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic machine, even grind every time.
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought this in May of 2014, it was great. Well, I figured I'd come back and give a five year update. It's still working great! Seriously. It's easy to disassemble for routine cleaning. It gives a really consistent grind every time. While this grinder is more expensive than others on here, it is actually worthy of the increased cost. If you're thinking about getting a cheap blade grinder, don't. Spend the money, this grinder is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: InkLady

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality
customer_reviews.text: Yes, some chaff gets stuck in the chute due to static, but that's the only small issue with this grinder. They could have fixed this by using a conductive material in the chute, but hey, a perfect product is extremely rare. Looking at the positive, this is an extremely well built grinder. The design is very simple yet overbuilt, and it's very easy to use. It has a larger capacity than you will ever need at home. I'm very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this grinder for my morning brew and the occasional espresso for about a month and a half now. The machine works as it should and I've been quite satisfied. The unit was somewhat easy to assemble. The collar with a rubber gasket that fits above the conical grinder was a bit tricky. So far the unit has worked perfectly. The fineness or coarseness of the grind is consistent and easy to adjust. Drawbacks are the unit is loud and the re-assembly of the hopper above the grinder can be tricky. Otherwise, perfect product.
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: For the money you won’t likely find a better grinder. The uniformity of grind is superb as is the durability of the brand. I looked for quite a long time for a grinder before landing on this one. I can say that this is by far the best grinder I’ve ever gotten. My only complaint, and it’s not a big deal, is that finely ground coffee gets stuck to the plastic through static charge. Not a big deal but it is a constant mess to manage.
customer_reviews.author: N. Hines

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it!!! You’ll be sorry.
customer_reviews.text: Should of heeded the warnings of others. I got 1, mediocre grind out of it. The next time I used it, it just sat there spinning. I took it apart and cleaned it 3 times, nothing. Returned it at Khols, which was really convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grinder for the pour over or chemex at home!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 of these work horse grinders! One for my cafe, one for my house and my dad just asked where he could get one so I surprised hime with one as well. It is extremely easy to use and has many settings to get the best grind depending on what coffee you are making. We make pour overs every morning so this tool has been used daily for over 2 years and is still going strong. With large amounts of coffee, it does take a while, but for the chemex or single pour over amount, this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Making Pretty Spaces

customer_reviews.title: This is a great grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good grinder and seems quite sturdy. I’ve had it for a couple of months and there is nothing like a good deep smell of freshly ground beans first thing in the morning. A luxury for me, but it makes every day just a little special to have that one excellent cup of coffee. Easy to clean, go to YouTube for the video. Only thing I don’t like is the noise, but cracking those beans is just noisy unless you close it up in a vault.
customer_reviews.author: PoetDoc

product_meta.title: Baratza Encore Conical Burr Coffee Grinder
feature_bullets: SPECIALTY COFFEE ASSOCIATION AWARD WINNING GRINDERS - Baratza grinders are preferred by coffee professionals and backed by Baratza’s world class support.
GO-TO ENTRY LEVEL GRINDER - Baratza’s best-selling grinder, with its small footprint, is THE choice for brewing coffee at home. Available in White or Black.
USER FRIENDLY - A convenient, front-mounted pulse button, plus a simple ON/OFF switch make it easy to grind fresh coffee.

40 GRIND SETTINGS - Engineered with 40mm commercial-grade conical burrs that help you explore the extensive range of brew methods (espresso, Aeropress, Hario V60, Chemex, French Press, and automatic brewers).

WARRANTY/QUALITY PARTS - Hardened alloy steel burrs manufactured in Liechtenstein, Europe, plus a powerful DC motor. This combination creates a consistent grind and durability to ensure the longevity users have come to expect from the Baratza brand. The Encore is backed by Baratza’s world class support and a 1 year warranty. 2020 Update has exact same trusted functionality with a sleek new exterior.
